website_summaries.verdict: More than just punch pliers, this tough tool comes with a comprehensive set of extras in an organized storage case to help tackle almost any hole-punching task.
pros: Punches holes in numerous materials, thanks to the solid metal construction
Handles are coated for an improved grip
Comes with 7 punches and dies in a variety of popular sizes
cons: Can be challenging for individuals with hand problems such as arthritis
Design makes it hard to see area as you punch holes

customer_reviews.title: Taiwanese made.  Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: This set is much, much better than the set I ordered through Grizzly (made in China.) This set is made in Taiwan and while the Grizzly and Neiko are virtually identical in design and the Grizzly set "looks" as sturdy and well made, it is not. The Neiko is far superior in fit and function. PS - this is not an indictment of Grizzly or Chinese products in general - but in this case, there is no comparison.
customer_reviews.author: T from Tennessee/Alabama

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I'm recreating the aviators desk from RH so ordered this punch to make 3/16" holes in two layers of 24 gauge zinc sheet metal and it punches thru with the squeeze from one hand! Only suggestion I could add to the product is some springs to recoil the handle back open for you but not a big deal for what I'm using it for currently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it, does what it should, and does it very well. Has an adjustment to set the distance for the holes it makes.
customer_reviews.text: I use to use one of these metal punches when i use t work with my uncle as a kid. We used it to punch holes in the edges of aluminum storm windows, so they could be screwed to the cover the regular window on the home. I bought it to punch holes into some 4" wide, 10 foot long heavy gauge steel, uses to cover the gap between a porch roof, where it joins the main roof. It punched holes effortlessly, and has a lot of different size holes it can punch. Very well made, you will never need to buy another of these, unless someone takes this from you.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: ... stud 18 ga and can do the work faily easy. I wish the handles a little longer for ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried to punch holes on a light gage stud 18 ga and can do the work faily easy. I wish the handles a little longer for better laverage. Did not try to use it on 16 gage material yet, but since it will be easy to use a self tapper screw instead for my particular use
customer_reviews.author: marce

customer_reviews.title: A real solidly made tool
customer_reviews.text: Works fine on thinner gauge back-saw plates. Not strong enough for larger carpentry panel saws but if you're restoring, making or re-handling a gents saw, dovetail saw or other back saw used for furniture joinery, this does a great job. Dies have a small point which easily finds the dimple left from using a machinist's transfer punch to mark handle screw locations. Reach is about two inches which should be enough for most back saws. Raises no burr and leaves the plate perfectly flat. I recommend always using a little light oil on the die and this sturdy tool should last a lifetime. The Neiko punch is a quality tool, not your usual imported junk.
customer_reviews.author: David AndersonTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: The only one that is heavy duty enough for horse tack!
customer_reviews.text: Having broken over a dozen hole punches on leather saddles and tack, this is the first one that appears it will hold up to heavy duty leather and regular use.
customer_reviews.author: sporting road

customer_reviews.title: Just as important as quality and value is support
customer_reviews.text: I think the tool will do what I need it to but when I first opened it the 3/32 punch and die were missing. At least I thought so, however they were already in the tool. Before I noticed that was the case I realized as others have said that this product really has no support. It appears that if those parts were indeed missing my only option would have been to send the tool back. There also appears to be no way to order parts should a part break? If I were able to do it all again I would buy from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Usalf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, bought it years ago and still using it.
customer_reviews.text: I adore this punch. I actually bought it years ago and I'm still using it weekly. It's never gone dull, and is simple to use. The only complaint I have is that the guard doesn't stay tightened, so if you need to use the guard be prepared to tighten it every use. I don't need it, so it's never been a problem for me. PRO TIP: Label the 'top' of the case. I don't know how many times I opened it upside-down only to spill the dies all over my studio.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Maddux

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on this and other hole punch kits. This seemed the best value for the money, and I was pleased with it. First, I don’t know anything about working with metal. I’ve been assembling a steampunk glove and needed to punch holes in copper sheets and in leather. The Neiko worked perfectly. It was intuitive to use (and a good thing as instructions were mostly lacking). The various bits were clearly labeled and pretty easy to change. Also, I don’t have a lot of hand strength but had no difficulty at all with the materials I was using (leather and 22 and 24 gauge copper sheets). It worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Good product, confusing product details
customer_reviews.text: The bits are easy to change out. The handles open very wide making it difficult to operate with just your hands (I placed the bottom handle on my foot for leverage). Typically, if I see an assembly that appears to have missing parts, I don't start messing around with the product (so I can return it in the same condition). Before thinking your product may be missing parts (the 3/32" bits primarily), make sure you check the tool itself as the die sometimes are pre-installed. Don't make the same mistake I did.
customer_reviews.author: Pyroguy

customer_reviews.title: Great for punching pennies
customer_reviews.text: This punch is great! Needed to punch pennies for a wedding. We punched 250 Canadian Pennies with the second smallest punch size. It was easy to punch and left very smooth holes. About every thirty punches you need to tighten the bar that holds the mold but that’s no problem.
customer_reviews.author: MelbaJ

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I use this for armor making. Punches clean holes through 16 and 18 GA mild steel pretty easily and they require no cleanup after the fact. Also punches decent holes in leather. Given the sturdiness of the tool it would be pretty reasonable to mount it to a block, add on a longer handle, and go to town on even thicker plates. The only slight irritation is how the bottom 'receiver' that accepts the punch bit is a little loose and requires frequent adjusting to get back into a flush position. Despite that I could not recommend it more.
customer_reviews.author: Jon D.

customer_reviews.title: 3/32 punch and die missing
customer_reviews.text: No way that I see to contact you. Ordered this, sent without the 3/32 punch and die component. Sent it back for a replacement. Same thing! Size missing again! The main reason we purchased this was for the smaller punches. We needed this yesterday not tomorrow!!! Very disappointed! We have a business and need it NOW! Update: issue was resolved. I use this punch set allot. Totally love it. Glad I purchased it. Hoping it continues to do the job needed.
customer_reviews.author: Love Doxies

customer_reviews.title: Quality Item
customer_reviews.text: I bought this particular item over identical looking ones on Amazon because it is manufactured in Taiwan, not mainland China. A friend bought on of the 'Made in China" items and it feels loose, doesn't align well and the cutters not accurately ground. This one is very nice. After punching 100 or so holes in razor wire for installation on one of my ranch fences, it's ready for the remaining 700 yards. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: P. G.

customer_reviews.title: Neiko 02612A Hole Punch Kit, 3/32" x 9/32" is Good, Amazon is Great!
customer_reviews.text: Neiko 02612A Hole Punch Kit with 7 sizes 3/32" to 9/32" was delivered with one size missing. I called customer service and they said they'll send a replacement. I returned the original shipment today and when I got back home replacement arrived with all of the sizes. Got it one day after I ordered it, sent it back the next day and also received another on the same day. Heavy duty sucker weighing in at 2 lbs. I expect to get my money's worth fur sure!
customer_reviews.author: Wethouse

customer_reviews.title: The Ultimate Hole Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality and heavy tool that punches hole in leather belts very fast, and the holes are very "clean" (no hanging pieces of leather). It might be a little intimidating for some users expecting a "simple" to use tool. To change the size of hole to be punched, the user has to "open" the tool to change the punch rod. One suggestion I'd made for the manufacturer would be to include an accessory that holds the tool staple. That is the only "negative" thing about this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Bones

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and awkward
customer_reviews.text: It was not easy to use and heavy. The handle isn't spring loaded, so you have to lift the handle, place in material ( without dropping all of it) and use both hands to punch hole in material (I was using strips of leather) very awkward. I initially got it Because of the part that keep the material straight when punching holes. Not recommended if you are using it for leather jobs. It wasn't a clean cut hole.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding punch system
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding punch system for several reasons: (1) It is very sturdy and I think it will provide many years of trouble free service; (2) It has separate punches and backing pieces so that holes can be punched with great precision; (3) It has a very useful guide to set the distance between the edge of the material and the placement of the punched hole; and (4) It comes in a sturdy carrying case that holds all of the parts. Overall, the best punch I have ever owned in the past 40 years!
customer_reviews.author: Beeze

customer_reviews.title: Centering punch to centerline of hole
customer_reviews.text: Unit is difficult to line up the center point of to be punched hole with male-female dies. There is a small almost invisible point on the end of male die. Very hard to see and align accurately. And because the hand held unit is so bulky, and heavy, it is not easy to hold the unit in one hand and part to be punched in the other. It does make a nice clean hole with little force. Comes with plastic carry case nicely done. On time delivery and good price. If it were for the poor ergonomic design, would have given five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Crow

customer_reviews.title: Cuts clean but needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: They do punch a clean hole into metal stamping blanks as intended. The bad thing about them is that changing the die to another size is cumbersome and the dies in my set are not labeled with the correct size. So i have to guess and use trial and error to get the correct size to match up on top and bottom. Overall it does cut a nice clean hole in your project
customer_reviews.author: christopher m.

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars Because of Lack of Seeing Where Hole is Being Punched
customer_reviews.text: I gifted this to a person that does a lot of crafts and they needed something to punch leather. They are very experienced and do beautiful work. I did quite a bit of research and chose this one. The recipient told me that it punched the holes flawlessly and with ease. The only problem they had was that they had no way of telling exactly where the hole was going make its final punch.
customer_reviews.author: Randall W. Rasner

customer_reviews.title: excellent tool.  Made well.
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a great tool. Saw it elsewhere for $60. Took me a while to figure out how to work it as instructions could be better, but once I figured it out I found it works great. Just have to make sure you check how parts were put in when you got in. SOmeone commented the screw driver piece didn't work. They probably put in the punch part in upside down. There is a groove in the side that faces down as shown in the picture showing where the screw driver goes. Very well made. I bought it to use on heavy papers and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Eudice

customer_reviews.title: I am BLOWN AWAY!
customer_reviews.text: OH MY GOD! I purchased this product with the firm assumption it would NOT work for my project, and I was sure I would have to return it. THIS PRODUCT IS AMAZING! IT WORKS PERFECTLY! I am so impressed. This is now one of my favorite tools! You could easily spend $200 on a similar product. A.M.A.Z.I.N.G!
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely solid tool. I have used it on everything from gasket material to sheet metal without issue. I am a picky customer when it comes to these types of tools and would absolutely buy this again. If I had any "criticism" it would be I wish that they would go larger in size. That would, however, eliminate punching of certain types of material at the larger sizes. Likely some people would be overly motivated to "make it work" nonetheless and would damage the tool or the work-piece. That's not really a criticism as much as a wish for my own unique needs. Buy it if the sizes meet your needs.
customer_reviews.author: kermit80526

customer_reviews.title: Must be used with two hands, depth stop bends
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this to punch holes for pop rivers in aluminum. It is plenty powerful and can punch 5 layers at once. The bummer about this tool is that the handles open so far apart from each other when you need to insert material that you must use both hands. You can’t operate it with material in one hand and the punch in the other. Also the depth guide continues to bend where it already is bent kind of defeating the purpose of an accurate depth stop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow Wow Wow
customer_reviews.text: This hole punch is incredible. I use it for punching holes for jewelry and don't have to struggle as I do with other hole punches designed specifically for jewelry. It also punches leather just fine. I wish I had this tool earlier. Easy to see and line up your punch.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Works well, with slight modifications
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to make holes in flashing, to ultimately attach using pop rivets. Also using this tool to punch holes in jar lids for mak8ng filter lids re making mushroom spawn. The gnurled adjusting screws need either lock washers or "o" rings like I used. Otherwise they work loose.
customer_reviews.author: Old man of the woods

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as described
customer_reviews.text: Unable to punch holes in 18 gauge steel. When inserted as instructions specify the die extends completely through the throat. With die lowered to bottom of throat and 18 gauge sheet metal in punch the handles starting position is 7 inches apart, making it impossible to grip and squeeze the handles. Might work well on plastic, but not on steel
customer_reviews.author: stephen lebsack

customer_reviews.title: Point of Failure in Handle
customer_reviews.text: Well, it lasted for about a dozen hole punches. The handle snapped in my hands. Looking at the point of failure, its a seriously weak point and thankfully it happened while i could still return it. Ive had harbor freight crap last longer than this...really disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I had a screw down hole punch which was leaving marks on my pieces and switched to this one. This is an Excellent hole punch which allows you to put a hole anywhere on a piece of metal. Totally worth the investment! It comes with multiple punch sizes. I bought a n additional 1.5mm punch from an online metal stamping supplier which fits into the punch perfectly. (Beaducation.com)
customer_reviews.author: Skk

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't changed in 30 years!
customer_reviews.text: These things are still too difficult to use. They take more arm power than necessary and can't get into tight areas well. It was 30 years ago since I purchased one, and they have not changed! Bring leveraged or gear action to this tool! At this point in history, just use a cordless drill with a bit...much lighter and easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: MARK A. DESALVO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent utility punch
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Instructions and markings on tool easy to calibrate. Multiple die sizes and ease of use to change them make it very versatile. Very sturdy tool to setup and operate. Worked for my purpose. No complaints. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bigfoot 6X10

customer_reviews.title: Covers every hole punching situation I could run into in making my jewelry!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. Wonderful tool. Very versatile. Covers every hole punching situation I could run into in my jewelry making avocation. Was also able to purchase a 1.5mm hole punch die set that fit perfectly with this Power Punch Pliers. Love the carrying case it comes in too! Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DL Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Neiko Hand Held Power Punch
customer_reviews.text: The Neiko Hand Held Punch has been a great purchase for me! I am female, have smaller hands, and have used it to punch through silver, copper, and brass, as thick as 14 ga with ease. I'm sure that someone with stronger hands could probably punch through thicker metal but I didn't want to push my luck. I'd definitely recommend the Neiko Hand Held Power Punch to anyone looking for a metal punch.
customer_reviews.author: C J

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: A good quality hand punch kit, this tool replaces a 20 year old Roper Whitney No 5 Jr. Punch that cost me 4 times the price of this new tool and looks and feels better than the old one ever did. The old tool is worn out and the dies are dull.
customer_reviews.author: CEO

customer_reviews.title: difficult to use, lacks precision
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to punch holes in 20 gauge steel. It is hard for me to manage the punch, and I find it hard to line it up correctly. If someone had not helped me figure out how to use it, I would have not kept it as it was not accessible to a neophyte. If anyone out there in amazonland has suggestions of a tool that would work for me, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: lucysky

customer_reviews.title: Works but handle will cause bruising .
customer_reviews.text: As other people have mentioned repetitve use of the tool does hurt that area of your hand right below your thumb . Next version should include a handle with padding of some sort. Overall it does what its supposed to do just make sure before you start whatever project it will be used that yoo plan and pace yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Troy N. Stennett

customer_reviews.title: I would be happier if the handle fit was more rigid
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to do but there is a lot of play in the handle. This makes it harder for those of us with small hands to control it. I would be happier if the handle fit was more rigid.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Hearne

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great price for this punch. Used several times on small projects and for what I paid they are a must buy. Not top of the line but definitely not junk. Small occasional projects? Great. Could have spent 4 or 6 times more for top of the line commercial quality but simply no need for that. It punches nice round holes in light sheet metal. Perfect for me. I'd buy again without question. I can buy a new pair every 5 years for the next 15 to 20 years and still be money ahead. That's a very hard deal to beat. With light use I actually expect a set to last 10-20 years each or more.
customer_reviews.author: Sailor Mon

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Neiko 02612A Multi-Purpose Power Hole Punch as described no surprises. This product is of reasonable quality and designed for light duty occasional hole punching when needed. It is not industrial quality and not a production tool as the price reflects such. If need be would repurchase and would recommend. At the minimum will locate a set of replacement dies as nothing last forever.
customer_reviews.author: EXPEDITION

customer_reviews.title: Most powerful handheld punch I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Well made of strong material, don't think I'll ever need to by another of this size. Have gotten away with drilling many holes and usually end up with scratched surfaces where the drill slipped. This tool will bring those type of mistakes to an end. Have now used the punch a few times and am very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and provides clean holes.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly easy to use and provides a clean hole. Used it to punch holes in sheet metal project where I used solid rivets to assemble at cooling tank for an old hit and miss engine I'm restoring.
customer_reviews.author: spicewoodtx

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and not so tight you have to break it in.
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed with how heavy duty this is.it punches through 032 aluminum great! In the past I have had to break them in to get them to move easily. This thing is smooth as butter.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: ... sheet metal for restoring a 68 mustang - worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: used it to punch through some sheet metal for restoring a 68 mustang - worked like a charm! I just wish there was a way you could "lock" the depth of the piece that threads in - it'll slowly work its way out on you - which is no big deal, it takes 2 secs to thread it back in half a thread, but would just make it even easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: StrattAg21

customer_reviews.title: Very strong.
customer_reviews.text: I've broken so many metal punches. Sadly, I didn't know a heavy duty punch existed until a few weeks ago. I'm so glad I found this. It cuts through stainless steel so effortlessly. There are a variety of settings that I won't need, but always good to have options.
customer_reviews.author: Smarie

customer_reviews.title: Using this punch makes perfect holes for the project I am using it for
customer_reviews.text: This item is an exchange to another one I received that was missing the 1/8 punch set. Amazon shipped the replacement right away I was able to return the 1st order without any issues. Using this punch makes perfect holes for the project I am using it for; thin 1mm aluminum sheets covered by a layer of stick on heat shield. Update: I should have gotten this years ago instead of using a drill.:) The only thing I would like improved is now far into the material you can make the hole, 2" is not enough for such a resourceful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: It beats drilling holes in sheet metal when a lot of holes are needed.
customer_reviews.text: It is a great tool, and does the job it is designed to do. When needed it is great for making holes in sheet metal, when a lot of holes are required. I use it to punch holes for riveting sheet metal during fabricating.
customer_reviews.author: G Wm Roy Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: They work...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this device would work - I saw several from around $21 and up - this one looked like the rest but a bit better than the cheapest so I bought it...to use to punch holes in some metal lamp fixtures to route wires...WOW - they work GREAT and really do minimize how hard you have to press - Not hard at all. It punched 9/32" thru .050" metal cleanly and without effort - A+
customer_reviews.author: DanR

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing for ceiling work
customer_reviews.text: Not great for acoustic ceilings. Takes a lot of oomph to punch through a main and wall angle together. The head is too large to get deep into the “meat” of the main. The river ends up being close to the edge. Also, the handles are spread way too open for someone with size large hands (or smaller).
customer_reviews.author: Rich Slomkowski

customer_reviews.title: Profwssional tool
customer_reviews.text: Very smoth operation - the tool is very easy and precise to use; professional grade. It has multiple sizes and the molded box is just perfect for keeping them together. Good product - I had no problem making holes into ceilling grid. Make sure you put something (a sheet of thin plastic in my case) between the wall and the tool to avoid indentations/scratching the wall when depressing the tool.
customer_reviews.author: ConAnna

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME INVESTMENT
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tool I've purchased for my metal stamping and jewlery. It works so easy and doesn't hurt my hand punching holes. In my opinion all the other hole punches for metal stamping is garbage compared to this one! Fast shipping too!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Easy instructions to change hole size.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband to use on dog collars. Punched holes easily. I had read reviews of some one else using it for dog collars.
customer_reviews.author: Availing

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, I highly recommend it to anyone who works with sheet metal.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tool when working with sheet metal and let me tell you, calling it durable is an understatement. Punch goes through just about anything that fits into the slot, and not only makes a clean burr free hole, but the punched out piece of metal is a perfect disc that I use for a lot of my sculptures. Only complaint is with the hole sizes. Could use a little larger range of hole sizes. Besides that I highly recommend this product, I use it multiple times daily and the tool is still rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Works well, a little cumbersome to switch tips
customer_reviews.text: Great for punching holes in sheet metal up to 18 gauge. I little bit of a pain switching out the various heads, but it works well and comes in a little case that houses all the components.
customer_reviews.author: CravinSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality punches & dies (dulled quickly)
customer_reviews.text: The punches & dies that come with this power punch are not durable. The one size I use to punch holes in thin aluminum sheeting has already dulled & now doesn’t punch all the way through. I’ve used it ~ 100 times in a few months. Very disappointing. Unfortunately, I can’t seem to find a 1/8 replacement punch & die without buying a whole set.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Malcomson

customer_reviews.title: Nice punch.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for punching holes in copper for my jewelry making hobby and it works great. I get a clean hole, and is fairly easy to center. It has a decent throat reach. I have no difficulty with squeezing the punch, fits my hand comfortably. I have the Euro hand punch which works very well, but if you need a variety of sizes (the smallest is slightly larger than my Euro Punch) this tool is great to have.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Voulgaris

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Ive punched holes in copper, brass, and even 16 g hot rolled carbon steel with this puppy. It works great. The only issue I have with it is that the bottom piece that the punch fits into does not screw in tight and requires occasional adjustments to get a clean punch every time. I always check this piece every time I make a punch even if I am doing a bunch in a row just to make sure it is in the right place.
customer_reviews.author: Nik88

customer_reviews.title: Punches holes with ease
customer_reviews.text: I noticed there were quite a few of these on Amazon, this one was prime and had a lot of good reviews so I got it. I build robots with 1/16th aluminum or steel sheets and this is able to punch large holes fast and easy. It beats drilling the metal for sure. I highly recommend this if you are doing any project that requires more than a few holes in sheet metal. The only slight problem is that the spacer between the handles is smaller than my fingers. So if I put a lot of pressure on the top handle, when the punch goes through my fingers will hit the bottom handle.
customer_reviews.author: JackTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Hard to precisely place holes.
customer_reviews.text: It is extremely difficult to precisely place holes. You cannot see the center as you close the punch. It easily punches through 2 pieces of .080 Kydex. The holes are very clean. It does tend to leave a slight scuff around the hole on one side of the material, so make sure you know which side is the back of the piece.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Beckey

customer_reviews.title: A super great deal.
customer_reviews.text: The best hole punch I have ever had or seen. This is no toy or piece of junk. I have used it and found it to be powerful and precise. It utilizes compound action which makes it cut like a knife through butter. At 3 and 1/2 lbs, that is a lot of steel with 7 hardened dies and punches.I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Much to complicated for normal use.  Much to hard to canter on the object.
customer_reviews.text: Much to complicated for normal use. Much to hard to center on the object. Very heavy and cumbersome. A simple old fashioned puch with a rotatable head with different punch sizes would have served me better at a much lower cost. Unless you are a pro looking for a very heavy duty punch don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. I was working with 14 gauge aluminum blanks and my small hole punchers were just dying trying to punch through them. This hole punch does the trick easily, and I don't feel like I'm damaging it. I love all of the size options as well. It is a heavy unit, but it makes sense for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: Widf5

customer_reviews.title: The depth gauge is quite handy when trying to get consistent placement of the holes.
customer_reviews.text: We are using this to punch holes in planting pots and laminated tags for the pots, in our nursery. It has been working great and we've done several hundred already.
customer_reviews.author: BobCat Acres

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a metal hole punch but it works fantastic on thick nylon webbing also. Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Baked alaska

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this to punch holes in medium chipboard (bent my standard hole punch).......punches like butter. No more pressure than punching a hole in a single sheet of copy paper. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: bbean

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, a little hard to use with small parts. Returned it do not able fit my needs
customer_reviews.author: CARDA

customer_reviews.title: Get it its good product to have
customer_reviews.text: I like this product a lot I have tried to find a product that could make holes so that can MB make earrings and I have find the right one to do that very thing and more
customer_reviews.author: Angela Morales

customer_reviews.title: great gadget!
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that it isn't spring-loaded. That would make it easier for repeated use. Other than that, this little sucker is strong and is worth the money. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany O.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy tool.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased smaller punch. Broke on second try. Ordered this and it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ron H aka Batman

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool!
customer_reviews.text: If you need to punch holes in leather, plastic, or other materials, this is the hole punch you need. It's really easy on the hands and precise. It includes numerous sizes and is easy to use. The case holds everything together nicely.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Only for tin metal.
customer_reviews.text: Will only punch through very thin soft metal. Like a penny at best.
customer_reviews.author: Re Viewer

customer_reviews.title: Dependable!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few of these punch kits. They are made very well. And priced more reasonably than from specialty retailers. I have bought a few Neiko told over the years. They have all held up over time. Much better than
customer_reviews.author: MEZ0088

customer_reviews.title: Good punch, but could use more leverage.
customer_reviews.text: we needed to punch 1/8 relief holes in 16g stainless steel. the punch dies are capable of doing this, but now with the short handles that this has, we added 14" pipe handles and now the tool is much more useable.
customer_reviews.author: AlexB

customer_reviews.title: Does whit is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Good little punch thus far. Have really only used to punch holes for pop rivets for some custom ductwork. Have great plans for it. Wish/hope I can get replacement punch & dies.
customer_reviews.author: /Dev/Null

customer_reviews.title: missing part like the tool
customer_reviews.text: disliked the missing part like the tool very well built am i getting a replacement tool or what is required by me sincerely jackie rickett
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Rickett

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I wish the jaws were slightly wider, but this product saves me so much time drilling holes in sheet metal that It doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Hamilton K.

customer_reviews.title: sheet metal punch
customer_reviews.text: I've only had a few chances to use this tool so far, but the tool works exactly as you would expect. I was able to punch some holes in the metal of a part I was replacing on my car to use as a plug weld - worked great. Only drawback that I would say about the tool is that the handle tends to be a little wide once the metal is inserted - make it a little difficult to squeeze, but it can be done. Might need to experiment more with adjustments on the tool to see if it can be adjusted not so far apart.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Parker

customer_reviews.title: Good One!
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality. Well made for the dollars. Okay to buy this one. Wish handles were longer for leverage punching sheet metal.
customer_reviews.author: G Man

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Well Made and it does what I need it to do. I did my own modification by grinding down the pointed portion on the underside and tapping in two machine bolts to secure it down on a raised platform for precision work but the handle does not want to stay in the up position on its own but I will correct that later perhaps. Love it. Priced right for the quality and it is versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Teshuvah

customer_reviews.title: It actually works
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried that this thing wouldn't work at all but it punched holes in light gauge steel studs with little problem. It's very difficult to determine EXACTLY where the hole is going to be because of visibility (It's hard to actually see where the punch meets the material. Also, I think the device kept slipping a couple millimeters during the actual punching action. Unless you need extremely accurate placement, this device will work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: CompGeek75

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. I use it to punch holes in aluminum for metal stamping. It is so easy to use and leaves a very nice and clean hole with no sharp edges.
customer_reviews.author: Ta Feiter

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Buy one.
customer_reviews.text: It punches holes easily in sheet metal. Clean cut. No jagged edges.
customer_reviews.author: Xerxes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Adjust
customer_reviews.text: This tool comes with extra punches in various sizes. I found that it was easy to replace the punches and also to use the tool on aluminum sheets of various thickness. I also punched a few holes in some DVDs and plastic cards with no problem. I would recommend adjusting the tool so that you do not leave marks around the punched area. Over all this was a well made and easy to use tool for it's purpose. The only down side is that it is a little on the heavy side.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Marciniszy

customer_reviews.title: beats the hell out of drilling
customer_reviews.text: I used this to punch like a hundred holes in my new VW floor pans so I could weld them in. punch works very well. only giving it 4 stars because the little screw driver tool that comes with it is flimsy and the punch inserts thread in but do not lock so it needs to be checked every few holes. the tool itself is pretty nice and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Very nice hole punch
customer_reviews.text: A little complicatd to use but works great. Not too bad to put together. Seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: class2canoe

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It's a solid punch, that's for sure. I have 2 issues: 1) it doesn't cut clean. On medium weight leather and fabric it tears a hole but it doesn't cut the whole way around 2) the bottom anvil protrudes out making it difficult to slide under the material.
customer_reviews.author: Robert s Porter

customer_reviews.title: Works great on Thermoplastics
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use in our Outpatient Therapy clinic as a punch for splint material. Works great cuts through our 1/8th inch thermoplastics with ease. Only bummer is it doesn't have a spring to re open after each punch, but I knew that going in. Swapping out sizes is a piece of cake and not time consuming. Feels extremely well made and should last us for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty well on 16 gauge cold rolled sheet metal....kinda tough but made a nice hole..clean no burrs.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Minskey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very solid, heavy tool. Well made. Quickly punches through coins with ease!
customer_reviews.author: lmw

customer_reviews.title: awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: I know this is a Taiwanese copy of an American-made tool, so maybe I should give credit to Roper-Whitney, but this seems to be just as solid and punches through even 0.035" titanium or hardened stainless sheet with no problems. Before I had this, making holes in sheet metal was a pain, but now it's actually fun. The dies screw in and out really easily, so to avoid slippage I may end up wrapping them in teflon tape, but it doesn't cause any functional problems.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: Neiko 02612A Multi-Purpose Hole Punch.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this tool. Already used it to cut tail lights reflectors, turn signal reflectors, head light reflectors from red, amber, and clear plastic. The reflectors was for my two grandsons soap box cars. Both boys received a trophy for their entry. One received 3rd place design trophy for his car. Without this tool, the reflectors would not have turned out as good. Thank you for this product....!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty hole punch
customer_reviews.text: What a beast, I don’t think this hole punch will bend like my other punch did. The service was great, just a pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Tony K. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great punch for several applications!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for punching clean holes in tin containers I needed to vent, do however watch that what you are punching does not have tall sides, as you may have issues feeding it. I now have 2 of these and love them!
customer_reviews.author: Pete S.

customer_reviews.title: and for that it works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a quality tool. I'm using it for making small thin washers from shim stock, and for that it works like a charm. Be prepared though, you'll get a good workout from just picking it up! The tool has some mass to it ,and is far from flimsy. Changing the dies is quick and simple. The tool is well made and should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy

customer_reviews.title: Great punch!
customer_reviews.text: I got this punch to use for crafting projects. So far I have used it on leather, and it works just fine! I know that it is rated for metal, but it will work on just about anything, metal, leather, etc. It is also very powerful. It has a mechanism which allows more force to be applied to the material through leverage and simple physics. Basically, it means less work for your hands!
customer_reviews.author: C. G. Rackley

customer_reviews.title: hand punch quicker and cleaner than a drill
customer_reviews.text: This is the ideal solution for sheet metal as it will punch a quicker and cleaner hole than a drill. It leave a perfect hole which is virtually burr free. Why didnt I get one sooner? Didnt get around to it. Eh, I'll just drill a hole. Now that it is available it gets used all the time. Of course it cannot punch more than 2 " past the edge, actually its just under in real life. And 16 gauge is its safe limit, but is an upper limit.
customer_reviews.author: Ron H

customer_reviews.title: Very good for metal holes.
customer_reviews.text: Already tried with a spond about 18ga and just worked perfect, I have to try this out with some meshes and see how it works out.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive punch ideal for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy punch if you infrequently work sheet metal, but be sure that the you are bearing down on the piece you intend to punch rather than the metal slide limiting distance between the jaws. I was struggling with punching what should have been an easy piece of sheet metal one day and just couldn't close the jaws. I realize that I was squeezing the slide, so I moved it in. Oops.
customer_reviews.author: Astrofiz

customer_reviews.title: One of the dies is already loaded in the punch
customer_reviews.text: I sent this item back once because I was tired and did not realize that one of the dies was in the punch. Just saw the empty holes, closed the package back up and returned it. It would be helpful if there was some way of contacting the seller when there is a problem instead of just returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: Luwana Koenig

customer_reviews.title: Definitely heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I got this for working with leather and multiple layers of heavy duty cloth. While I haven't put it to the full test yet, I'm sure it will fit the bill. My only issue with it, is that the handles open wider than my grip! I can't use it with only one hand, so I'll be struggling a bit for accuracy trying to use two hands to position my leather/fabric and operate the punch. But, a tool that will punch through these materials easily is half the battle.
customer_reviews.author: CCK

product_meta.title: Neiko 02612A Multi-Purpose Power Hole Punch Kit, 3/32" x 9/32"
product_meta.description: Durable power punch tool for precision holes through all types of materials. From thin brass metal to plastic sheet through 16 gauge mild steel. Features with an adjustable edge guide, easily lets you align holes in a straight line 1/4 to 1-1/2 inch from the edge. Package comes with seven quick-change, durable heat treated punch-and-die sets. Sizes from 3/32, 1/8, 5/32, 3/16, 7/32, 1/4 and 9/32 inch. Punch opens to 1/4 inch; throat depth: 1-3/4 inch. Storage and carrying case included.
feature_bullets: 2.25 lb super duty all metal construction makes it the most powerful hand held hole punch in the market
Compound high leverage design gets the job done more efficiently and requires less effort
Precisely machined chrome vanadium steel punches and dies hardened to 52 hardness creates clean holes through sheet metals up to 16 gauge
Includes 7 sizes of punches and dies: 3/32”, 1/8”, 5/32”, 3/16”, 7/32”, 1/4”, 9/32”, 1-pc throat depth gauge and 1-pc heavy duty storage case
Ideal for punching holes on a variety of materials and applications including aluminum, brass, steel sheet metal, leather, polyurethane, plastic, canvas, cardboard, paper, belt, shoes and more

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars822 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
